trans-unit.source: How Messages get Routed from a Bridge
trans-unit.target: How Messages get Routed from a Bridge

trans-unit.source: There can be many aspects to a simple routing operation between two components of a message flow.
trans-unit.target: There can be many aspects to a simple routing operation between two components of a message flow.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Where to route the message to?</embeddedLabel> As part of this, you define the destination of the message that has been processed by the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Where to route the message to?</embeddedLabel> As part of this, you define the destination of the message that has been processed by the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>On what condition will the routing be done?</embeddedLabel> This typically is driven by the business scenario which describes the parameters on which the routing is done.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>On what condition will the routing be done?</embeddedLabel> This typically is driven by the business scenario which describes the parameters on which the routing is done.

trans-unit.source: For example, all requests for mobile phone divisions should be passed on to department A, and so on.
trans-unit.target: For example, all requests for mobile phone divisions should be passed on to department A, and so on.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>In which order should the routing be done?</embeddedLabel> If there is more than one condition for routing, you must also set the order in which the routing conditions are honored.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>In which order should the routing be done?</embeddedLabel> If there is more than one condition for routing, you must also set the order in which the routing conditions are honored.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Do any specific actions need to be performed on the message before routing?</embeddedLabel> This is especially targeted for protocol bridging scenarios where the message sender and the message receiver operate on different message protocols.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Do any specific actions need to be performed on the message before routing?</embeddedLabel> This is especially targeted for protocol bridging scenarios where the message sender and the message receiver operate on different message protocols.

trans-unit.source: To bridge such protocol mismatch, you can perform certain actions on the message before it is finally routed.
trans-unit.target: To bridge such protocol mismatch, you can perform certain actions on the message before it is finally routed.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how the protocol mismatch is bridged, see <link xlink:href="2b28ccb0-dd88-4fbc-a5c4-c3b797a901e8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Route and Send Actions: Bridging Protocol Mismatch</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on how the protocol mismatch is bridged, see <link xlink:href="2b28ccb0-dd88-4fbc-a5c4-c3b797a901e8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Route and Send Actions: Bridging Protocol Mismatch</link>.

trans-unit.source: All these points are discussed in detail, with instructions on how to achieve them, at <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Connecting two Message Flow Components</link>.
trans-unit.target: All these points are discussed in detail, with instructions on how to achieve them, at <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Connecting two Message Flow Components</link>.
